net.cloud.gfx.elements

Class HorizontalView

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.elements.AbstractElement
      • net.cloud.gfx.elements.HorizontalView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Container<Element>, Element, Focusable

    public class HorizontalView
extends AbstractElement
implements Container<Element>
    A container that shows all of the elements within it. Unlike the interface, which respects the location of each of the elements, this will show all of the elements in a horizontal row. The elements may have some padding between them and the next, as well as have some alignment. For convenience, a view-wide policy on alignment and padding may be enforced, so all elements will have the same alignment and padding regardless of individual options. Note that added elements will have their focus chain changed to be naturally ordered within this view, and their X coordinates will be updated to reflect their position within this view.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  HorizontalView.HorizontalViewElement
      Decorator that adds two fields to an element that's been added to the view.

        protected java.util.List<HorizontalView.HorizontalViewElement> children
        Our list of elements. We don't order by priority, so ElementList is not suitable.

        private java.util.Optional<Alignment> alignment
        Default alignment within the view. If it exists, it is used. Otherwise the individual element's settings will be used.

        private int padding
        Default padding within the view. If set, it is used. Otherwise, the individual element's settings will be used

    • Constructor Detail

      • HorizontalView

        public HorizontalView()
        Create a new horizontal view which will have the default element attributes.

      • HorizontalView

        public HorizontalView(int x,
                      int y,
                      int height)
        Create a horizontal view that will be at the given location, and have the given height. The height is pretty important... needed to interact with view elements and align them. The width will adjust on its own as needed.
        Parameters:
        x - X location
        y - Y location
        height - Height

      • HorizontalView

        public HorizontalView(int x,
                      int y,
                      int height,
                      Alignment alignment,
                      int padding)
        Create a new horizontal view that will be at the given location and be the given height. It will also use a global policy of using the given alignment and padding. The width will adjust on its own as needed.
        Parameters:
        x - X location
        y - Y location
        height - Height
        alignment - Global alignment setting, null for not present
        padding - Global padding setting. HorizontalView.PADDING_NOT_SET for not present, else non-negative

        Common initialization. Sets the focus handler, children, alignment, and padding.

                          throws IteratorException

        Throws:

      • drawElement

        public void drawElement(java.awt.Graphics g,
                        int offsetX,
                        int offsetY)
                 throws IteratorException
        Draw each of the child elements down horizontally, taking padding into account. The children will have their X coordinates adjusted as this proceeds to reflect their current position. The Y position takes only one thing into account, depending on which is present. In order: View alignment, child alignment, child Y position
        Specified by:
        drawElement in interface Element
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object to draw to
        offsetX - How far off on the X axis this element is from the Graphic's origin
        offsetY - How far off on the Y axis this element is from the Graphic's origin
        Throws:
        IteratorException - If there was an issue iterating child elements

      • simpleDraw

        private void simpleDraw(java.awt.Graphics g,
                        int offsetX,
                        int offsetY)
                 throws IteratorException
        Simply draw all of the children in the view
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object
        offsetX - Offset X
        offsetY - Offset Y
        Throws:
        IteratorException - If iteration fails

      • optimizedDraw

        private void optimizedDraw(java.awt.Graphics g,
                           int offsetX,
                           int offsetY)
                    throws IteratorException
        Draw only the children that are currently in view. This means optimized drawing must be enabled. It also relies on the graphics clip, so if that is not set, then this will revert back to the simple algorithm.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object
        offsetX - Offset X
        offsetY - Offset Y
        Throws:
        IteratorException - If the simple draw has failed due to an IteratorException

      • findFirstDrawIndex

        private int findFirstDrawIndex(int topViewableX)
        Find which child index drawing should start at, so that all children in view are shown. Only useful during optimized drawing.
        Parameters:
        topViewableX - The top X coordinate, relative to us, drawing will happen at
        Returns:
        The index of the first child to draw

      • findFirstDrawIndexIteratively

        private int findFirstDrawIndexIteratively(int topViewableX)
        Iteratively looks through all children to find which index to start drawing at. Only useful during optimized drawing.
        Parameters:
        topViewableX - The top X coordinate, relative to us, drawing will happen at
        Returns:
        The index of the first child to draw

      • findFirstDrawIndexUsingPrevious

        private int findFirstDrawIndexUsingPrevious(int topViewableX)
        Find which child drawing should begin with, using an optimized algorithm that starts looking at the index that drawing previously started at. (Based on the assumption that the clip and offset aren't usually going to change.) Only useful during optimized drawing.
        Parameters:
        topViewableX - The top X coordinate, relative to us, drawing will happen at
        Returns:
        The index of the first child to draw

      • lookForwardFrom

        private int lookForwardFrom(int idx,
                            int topViewableX)
        Find which child drawing should begin with, looking forward from the given index until a child will need to be drawn to show given the top viewable X coordinate
        Parameters:
        idx - Index to start from (actually only look ahead of this index)
        topViewableX - The top X coordinate, relative to us, drawing will happen at
        Returns:
        The index of the first child to draw

      • lookBackwardFrom

        private int lookBackwardFrom(int idx,
                             int topViewableX)
        Find which child drawing should begin with, looking backward from the given index until a child will need to be drawn to show given the top viewable X coordinate
        Parameters:
        idx - Index to start from (actually only look behind this index)
        topViewableX - The top X coordinate, relative to us, drawing will happen at
        Returns:
        The index of the first child to draw

      • drawChildrenWithinView

        private void drawChildrenWithinView(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                    int offsetX,
                                    int offsetY,
                                    int bottomViewableX,
                                    int indexOfFirstChildToDraw)
                             throws IteratorException
        Draw children that will appear within view, starting at the given index and going until drawing would happen beyond the bottom coordinate. Along the way this sets the X coordinate of the elements that have been drawn.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object
        offsetX - Offset X
        offsetY - Offset Y
        bottomViewableX - Lowest X coordinate that will show
        indexOfFirstChildToDraw - Which child to start drawing with
        Throws:
        IteratorException - If thrown while drawing a child element

      • reconcileRemovals

        private void reconcileRemovals()
        Take care of pending remove requests in the remove queue. This will remove them from the children list, update the partial height sum of its siblings, as well as the overall height of this view. This does not synchronize, so it cannot happen while iterating the children elsewhere

      • reconcileAdditions

        private void reconcileAdditions(java.awt.Graphics g)
                         throws IteratorException
        Process pending requests to add a child to the view. This adds the element to this view, and then updates the overall width of the view. This child is drawn far offscreen, so that its width will be validated
        Parameters:
        g - A graphics object drawing is happening on
        Throws:
        IteratorException - If it occurs while drawing the element offscreen

      • add

        public void add(Element newChild)
        Add the given child to this view. The child will not have any alignment, and will not have any padding. Its focus chain will be linked to this view's natural ordering
        Specified by:
        add in interface Container<Element>
        Parameters:
        newChild - The element to add to this container

      • add

        public void add(Element newChild,
                Alignment alignment)
        Add the given child to this view, giving it the provided alignment but not padding Its focus chain will be linked to this view's natural ordering
        Parameters:
        newChild - The element to add to the view
        alignment - The alignment this child will use if there is no view-wide setting

      • add

        public void add(Element newChild,
                int padding)
        Add the given child to this view, giving it the provided padding but no alignment. Its focus chain will be linked to this view's natural ordering
        Parameters:
        newChild - The element to add to this view
        padding - The padding this child will use if there is no view-wide setting

                Alignment alignment,

        Parameters:

        alignment - The alignment this child will use if there is no view-wide setting
        padding - The padding this child will use if there is no view-wide setting

      • remove

        public boolean remove(Element child)
        Removes the child from this view, if it is a child of the view. The view will have its height updated, and the child will have its parent nullified and be removed from the focus chain
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Container<Element>
        Parameters:
        child - The element to remove from this Container
        Returns:
        True if the element was indeed removed

      • removeAllChildren

        public void removeAllChildren()
        Removes all of the children from the view. For all of them, their parent link is nullified and the focus links are set back to as if there are no children. (Because, well, there aren't.)
        Specified by:
        removeAllChildren in interface Container<Element>

      • hasOptimizationEnabled

        public boolean hasOptimizationEnabled()
        Returns:
        True if this view is assuming no changes to height of child elements

      • setOptimizedDrawing

        public void setOptimizedDrawing(boolean enabled)
        Turn on or off optimized drawing. This will reduce the amount of drawing done from all elements in the view, to only those that would show within the current graphics clip. To do this, all of the elements in the view must never have their width changed after they have been added to this view. (So for example, a TextArea may not have its text changed) Will do nothing if it is being set on but already on, or being set off and already off
        Parameters:
        enabled - True if optimization should be turned on

      • enableOptimization

        private void enableOptimization()
        Assumes it's okay to do this. Initialize what is necessary to turn it on

      • disableOptimization

        private void disableOptimization()
        Assumes it's okay to do this. De-initialize what is necessary to turn it off

      • hasAlignment

        public boolean hasAlignment()
        Returns:
        True if the view has a view-wide alignment setting

        Returns:
        The view-wide alignment setting

        Parameters:

        Throws:

        private int yPosFor(HorizontalView.HorizontalViewElement child)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • yCoordForAlignment

        private int yCoordForAlignment(Alignment alignment,
                               int availableHeight,
                               int elementHeight)
        Find the y coordinate drawing should take place from given an alignment factor.
        Parameters:
        alignment - The alignment in use
        availableHeight - The parent width
        elementHeight - The child width
        Returns:
        The y coordinate to draw at

      • paddingFor

        private int paddingFor(HorizontalView.HorizontalViewElement child)
        Figure out how much padding to use for the given child element. This is the padding between this child and the next. Takes into consideration which padding is present and has priority
        Parameters:
        child - The element being drawn
        Returns:
        The padding between the child and its next sibling

      • linkAddedChild

        private void linkAddedChild(HorizontalView.HorizontalViewElement child)
        Link a recently added child into this view. The assumption is that the child was added to the end of the view. The links will be created between this child and either the previous child or the view itself, and the child and the focusable after this view if there is one
        Parameters:
        child - The child that was recently added

      • removeLink

        private void removeLink(Element child)
        Maintain the focus link for the child being removed. This will maintain the first and last child attributes of the focus handler, as well as maintaining the links by merging the child's previous and next focusables.
        Parameters:
        child - The child being removed

      • linkAfterRemoveAll

        private void linkAfterRemoveAll()
        Maintain the focus handler's links after removing all children

      • linkNextFocusable

        public void linkNextFocusable(Focusable current,
                              Focusable next)
        Link this container to another Focusable so that after focus has traversed through this container's children, it will then go onto the provided Focusable. If there is no child to traverse to, then the link will instead be from this container itself to the provided Focusable to preserve the traversal chain.
        Specified by:
        linkNextFocusable in interface Focusable
        Parameters:
        current - The focusable object being linked to next
        next - The next Focusable in line

      • linkPreviousFocusable

        public void linkPreviousFocusable(Focusable current,
                                  Focusable previous)
        Link this container to another Focusable so that the given Focusable will lead to this container. Rather than leading directly to the first child, the link will be made between the previous and this container. The container will then link to the first child, so it's sort of like a two-step connection. If there are no children, then it won't make the second link and the traversal will just be one step.
        Specified by:
        linkPreviousFocusable in interface Focusable
        Parameters:
        current - The focusable object being linked to previous
        previous - The previous Focusable in line
